local_schema.longdesc: Press Space to select the candidate.
Choose phrases from the back, without moving cursor.
Number of candidate per page.
In plain Zhuyin mode, automatic candidate selection and related options are disabled or ignored.
Always input numbers when number keys from key pad is inputted.

Occasionally, the CapsLock status does not match the IM, this option determines how these status be synchronized. Valid values: "disable": Do nothing. "keyboard": IM status follows keyboard status. "IM": Keyboard status follows IM status.
Ignore CapsLock status and input lowercase by default. It is handy if you wish to enter lowercase by default. Uppercase can still be inputted with Shift.
Maximum Chinese characters in pre-edit buffer, including inputing Zhuyin symbols
Escape key cleans the text in pre-edit-buffer.
Easy symbol input.
Add phrases in the front.
Automatically move cursor to next character.
Hsu's keyboard selection keys, 1 for asdfjkl789, 2 for asdfzxcv89 .
Keys used to select candidate. For example "asdfghjkl;", press 'a' to select the 1st candidate, 's' for 2nd, and so on.
Select Zhuyin keyboard layout.
The history of the 100 last calls
List of configured LDAP servers
If enabled, offline contacts will be shown in the roster

local_schema.short_desc: List of folded groups in the roster
Type of Service (TOS) byte on outgoing RTP IP packets
local_schema.longdesc: The Type of Service (TOS) byte on outgoing RTP IP packets. This byte is used by the network to provide some level of Quality of Service (QoS). Default value 184 (0xB8) correspond to Expedited Forwarding (EF) PHB as defined in RFC 3246.
The list of accounts to which Ekiga should register

local_schema.short_desc: Forward calls to the given host if no answer
local_schema.longdesc: If enabled, all incoming calls will be forwarded to the host that is specified in the field below if you do not answer the call

local_schema.short_desc: Forward calls to the given host if busy
local_schema.longdesc: If enabled, all incoming calls will be forwarded to the host that is specified in the field below if you already are in a call or if you are in busy mode

local_schema.short_desc: Always forward calls to the given host
local_schema.longdesc: If enabled, all incoming calls will be forwarded to the host that is specified in the field below
The range of UDP ports that Ekiga will use.
The range of TCP ports that Ekiga will use for the H.323 H.245 channel. This port range has no effect if both participants to the conference are using H.245 Tunneling.
The host where calls should be forwarded if call forwarding is enabled

Select the mode for sending DTMFs. The values can be 0 (for "String"), 1 (for "Tone"), 2 (for "RFC2833"), or 3 (for "Q.931") (default is "String"). Choosing other values than "String" disables the Text Chat.
Select the H.239 Video Role. The values can be 0 (for "disable extended video"), 1 (for "allow per content role mask"), 2 (for "force presentation"), or 3 (for "force live role")
This enables H.239 capability for additional video roles

Connection will be established in Fast Start mode. Fast Start is a new way to start calls faster that was introduced in H.323v2. It is not supported by Netmeeting and using both Fast Start and H.245 Tunneling can crash some versions of Netmeeting
This enables H.245 early in the setup

This enables H.245 Tunneling mode. In H.245 Tunneling mode H.245 messages are encapsulated into the H.225 channel (port 1720). This saves one TCP connection during calls. H.245 Tunneling was introduced in H.323v2 and Netmeeting does not support it. Using both Fast Start and H.245 Tunneling can crash some versions of Netmeeting.
The port to listen to for incoming connections. Ekiga needs to be restarted for the new value to take effect.
Enter the number of seconds after which Ekiga should try refreshing the NAT binding when STUN is being used
Select the mode for sending DTMFs. The values can be 0 (for "RFC2833") and 1 (for "INFO")
The host where calls should be forwarded if call forwarding is enabled
The SIP Outbound Proxy to use for outgoing calls
The port to listen to for incoming connections. Ekiga needs to be restarted for the new value to take effect
Whether to prefer to sustain the max. frame rate or lower it possibly in order to keep a minimum level of (spatial) quality for all frames. 0: Highest minimal quality, 31: lowest minimal quality
The maximum RX video bitrate in kbit/s. This value will be signaled to the peer endpoint that can adjust (if it supports it) its TX bitrate if it is above the signaled value

The maximum TX video bitrate in kbit/s. The video quality and the number of transmitted frames per second (depends on selected codec) will be dynamically adjusted above their minimum during calls to try to minimize the bandwidth to the given value
The video codecs list
The maximum jitter buffer size for audio reception (in ms)
If enabled, use echo cancellation
If enabled, use silence detection with the codecs supporting it
The audio codecs list

local_schema.short_desc: Kind of network selected in the assistant
local_schema.longdesc: 0: 56kbps, 1: ISDN, 2: DSL128, 3: DSL512, 4: LAN, 5: Custom
If enabled, automatically answer incoming calls
Automatically reject or forward incoming calls if no answer is given after the specified amount of time (in seconds)
The position of the remote video window
The size of the remote video window

local_schema.short_desc: The video view before having switched to fullscreen
local_schema.longdesc: The video view before having switched to fullscreen (same values as video_view)
The default video view (0: Local, 1: Remote, 2: Both, 3: Both in a separate window)

local_schema.short_desc: Place windows displaying video above other windows during calls
local_schema.longdesc: Place windows displaying video above other windows during calls
The zoom value in percent to apply to images displayed in the main GUI (can be 50, 100, or 200)
Specify the software scaling algorithm: 0: nearest neighbor, 1: nearest neighbor with box filter, 2: bilinear filtering, 3: hyperbolic filtering. Does not apply on windows systems.

Allow Ekiga to fall back to software scaling the picture-in-picture if hardware support is not available. If this is set to false, Ekiga will not try to open the PIP if hardware support is not available.
This key disables DirectX (on win32) and XVideo (on Linux) video hardware acceleration
Size of the preferences window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the preferences window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the preferences window
Size of the preferences window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the preferences window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the preferences window

local_schema.short_desc: Size of the video settings window
local_schema.longdesc: Size of the video settings window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the video settings window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the video settings window

local_schema.short_desc: Size of the audio settings window
local_schema.longdesc: Size of the audio settings window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the audio settings window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the audio settings window

local_schema.short_desc: Size of the address book window
local_schema.longdesc: Size of the address book window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the address book window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the address book window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the druid window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the druid window
Size of the druid window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the chat window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the chat window
Size of the chat window

local_schema.short_desc: Change the panel section of the main window
local_schema.longdesc: Change the panel section of the main window (0=Contacts, 1=Dialpad, 2=Call history)

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the main window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the main window
Size of the call window

local_schema.short_desc: Position on the screen of the call window
local_schema.longdesc: Position on the screen of the call window
Enable the automatic network setup resulting from the STUN test
The STUN server to use for STUN Support. STUN is a technology that permits passage through some types of NAT gateway
The sound that will be played at the end of calls or when calling somebody who is busy, if enabled
The chosen sound will be played at the end of calls or calling somebody who is busy, if enabled
The sound that will be played when calling somebody, if enabled
The chosen sound will be played when calling somebody, if enabled

local_schema.short_desc: Play sound on new voice mail
local_schema.longdesc: The chosen sound will be played when a new voice mail is received, if enabled
The sound that will be played when there is a new voice mail, if enabled
The chosen sound will be played when a new instant message is received, if enabled
The sound that will be played when there is a new instant message, if enabled
The chosen sound will be played on incoming calls, if enabled
The sound that will be played on incoming calls, if enabled
Select an alternative audio output device to use for sound events.
The long status information
The short status information
Enter your full name

The maximum transmitted frame rate in frames/s. This rate may not be reached in case a minimum quality was configure via a TSTO value smaller than 31 and the bitrate selected is not sufficient to support this minimum quality
Display images from your camera device
Select the format for video cameras (does not apply to most USB cameras)
The video channel number to use (to select camera, tv or other sources)
Select the transmitted video size: Small (QCIF 176x144) or Large (CIF 352x288)
Select the video input device to use. If an error occurs when using this device a test picture will be transmitted.
Select the audio input device to use
Select the audio output device to use

local_schema.short_desc: Whether a Midnight Commander menu item should be displayed
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, and if the terminal file manager "Midnight Commander" is installed, then an "Open in Midnight Commander" menu item will be displayed in the context menu.

local_schema.short_desc: Whether opening a terminal on the desktop opens a terminal in the home directory
local_schema.longdesc: If set to true, then opening a terminal on the desktop will open a terminal in the home directory. Otherwise, it will be opened in the desktop directory. Note that this key is irrelevant if the desktop directory is identical to the home directory.

GStreamer can put visualization plugins in a pipeline to transform audio stream in video frames. Default is goom but more visualization plugins will be ported soon. The visualization plugin can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.
GStreamer can record video from any number of input elements. Some possible choices are v4lsrc and videotestsrc. The video source can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.
Describes the selected input element.
GStreamer can record audio using any number of input elements. Some possible choices are osssrc, esdsrc and alsasrc. The audio source can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.

GStreamer can play video using any number of output elements. Some possible choices are xvimagesink, ximagesink, sdlvideosink and aasink. The videosink can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.

local_schema.short_desc: description for GStreamer audiosink for Audio/Video Conferencing
local_schema.longdesc: Describes the selected output element for Audio/Video Conferencing.
GStreamer can play audio using any number of output elements. Some possible choices are osssink, esdsink and alsasink. The audiosink can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.

local_schema.short_desc: description for GStreamer audiosink for Music and Movies
local_schema.longdesc: Describes the selected output element for Music and Movies.

local_schema.short_desc: GStreamer audiosink for Music and Movies
local_schema.longdesc: GStreamer can play audio using any number of output elements. Some possible choices are osssink, esdsink and alsasink. The audiosink can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.
Describes the selected output element.
GStreamer can play audio using any number of output elements. Some possible choices are osssink, esdsink and alsasink. The audiosink can be a partial pipeline instead of just one element.
